Pre-Game Insights: The ever-widening gap between Zimbabwe and Afghanistan was highlighted brightly in the ODI series, where the tourists barely raised a sweat to seal a clean sweep, apart from the run chase in the third ODI.
Zimbabwe fans are desperately looking for something to smile about. Before the Afghanistan tour, they lost a five-match T20I series 3-2 at home to Namibia in another confidence-sapping campaign.
With a T20 World Cup Qualifier campaign at home next month, Zimbabwe have a great chance here to pick up some momentum in their quest to participate in Australia later this year.
For Afghanistan, their agenda is to get back into the swing of things ahead of the World Cup.
Zimbabweâ€™s last series win was against Scotland in 2021. Milton Shumba struck 66 off 29 balls to lead Zimbabwe to a win in a decider in that series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The last T20Is played on this ground was between Zimbabwe and Bangladesh in 2021. The chasing team won two of the three games, with an average first innings score of 170.33.
More clear and cool weather is forecast in Harare.
